main event: A civilian in Weimar, California reported a sighting of 12 disc-shaped objects in the sky on August 18, 1949, moving at a speed of about 700 mph at an altitude of 5,000 feet. The objects were observed displaying unusual behavior, bobbing up and down due to rugged terrain.
interesting points: The formation of disc-shaped objects was observed moving from North to South to the West at a high speed of 700 mph.
The altitude of the objects was approximately 5,000 feet, and their behavior included bobbing up and down for 30 to 40 seconds due to rugged terrain.
The location of the sighting was in the mountainous and remote Sierra & Mother Lode Country, around 50 miles North of Donner Summit, Mount Rose, and Lake Tahoe.
The witness described the objects as disc-shaped with a diameter of 50-100 feet, moving in a hazy mist with no audible sound.
The witness made a sketch of the event and reported the incident to the Sheriff of Placer County.
